revised_title: Further Experiments on Fluid Resistance and Vessel Design
tldr: James Walker conducts experiments on fluid resistance and vessel design, finding that sharpness is more important in the bow of light vessels, while in vessels carrying heavy cargoes, it is more important in the stem. He also determines that the resistance to a flat surface does not exceed 1251b per square foot at a speed of one mile per hour, increasing at a rate higher than the square of the velocity for greater speeds.
